intro: Laserpitium panax var. glabratum, commonly known as the glabrous panax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, herbaceous scent. This variety is notable for its limited distribution and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
